episodeTitle: Launching the Counter Attack! Luffy and Law's Great Escape!
description: Law reveals his clever plan to escape from captivity by swapping seastone chains with fake ones, orchestrating a mass breakout. He restores Smoker and Tashigi to their original bodies while Zoro and Kin'emon help the rest escape the deadly poison gas.

events.title: Underworld Brokers React to Caesar's Captives
events.description: In the New World, underworld brokers watching Caesar's broadcast are stunned to see that he has captured the Warlord Trafalgar Law, the Straw Hat Pirates' captain and Nico Robin, and Vice Admiral Smoker all at once.
events.significance: Demonstrates the magnitude of Caesar's operation and sets up the tension for the escape. Shows that the events on Punk Hazard are being watched by major underworld players.

events.title: Kid Pirates Alliance Meeting
events.description: Eustass Kid and Killer meet with Scratchmen Apoo and Basil Hawkins to form an alliance between their three pirate crews. Despite initial tension when Apoo beats up one of Kid's subordinates, Killer mediates and the alliance discussion continues.
events.significance: Formation of a major pirate alliance between three Supernovas that will impact future events. Their goal is to eventually take down one of the Four Emperors.

quotes.text: When invited by the enemy, I come expecting a fight.
quotes.speaker: Scratchmen Apoo
quotes.context: Explaining why he attacked Kid's subordinate

quotes.text: The three crews came together to try and form an alliance.
quotes.speaker: Killer

events.title: Law's Seastone Chain Swap Revealed
events.description: Law reveals that during his stay at Caesar's lab, he secretly swapped the real seastone chains with fake normal chains. He orders Franky to create a smokescreen by firing at a destroyed ship, then breaks free from the 'seastone' chains to everyone's amazement.
events.significance: Demonstrates Law's strategic planning and cunning. This reveal shows he had been planning his escape all along and was never truly captured.

quotes.text: While I freeloaded at Caesar's house, I swapped most of the seastone chains with normal ones.
quotes.speaker: Trafalgar Law
quotes.context: Explaining his escape plan to Luffy

quotes.text: We needed the smokescreen to hide the fact that we're escaping.
quotes.speaker: Trafalgar Law
quotes.context: Explaining why they needed Franky to create smoke

events.title: Law Restores Smoker and Tashigi to Original Bodies
events.description: Law uses his Ope Ope no Mi powers to return Smoker and Tashigi to their original bodies, undoing the body swap that had occurred earlier in the arc. He secures their cooperation in exchange for their freedom.
events.significance: Resolves the body-swap subplot and creates an uneasy alliance between Law and the Marines. Shows Law's tactical thinking in gaining allies.

quotes.text: I have no reason to save you, but if Vergo loses his position due to you returning alive, that would be good.
quotes.speaker: Trafalgar Law

quotes.text: We have to live in order to protect our soldiers, bring Vergo to justice, and rescue the children.
quotes.speaker: Tashigi
quotes.context: Convincing Smoker to accept Law's deal

events.title: Escape from Shinokuni Poison Gas
events.description: Nami's group, riding on Brownbeard and accompanied by Brook, Sanji, Zoro, and Kin'emon on the dragon, desperately flee from the deadly Shinokuni poison gas that is spreading across the island.
events.significance: Creates urgency and tension as the characters race against time to reach the laboratory before being consumed by the poison.

quotes.text: I'm sorry for making you carry us in your injured state.
quotes.speaker: Nami

events.title: Zoro and Kin'emon Cut Through Laboratory Gate
events.description: As Brownbeard charges toward the closing laboratory shutter with the poison gas closing in, Zoro and Kin'emon work together to cut through the sealed iron gate, allowing everyone to enter the laboratory safely.
events.significance: Demonstrates the swordsmen's teamwork and cutting ability. Shows Kin'emon can cut through iron, establishing his combat capabilities.

quotes.speaker: Roronoa Zoro
quotes.context: Asking Kin'emon before they cut the gate

events.title: Luffy's Group Opens Gate for G-5 Marines
events.description: Luffy's group, with Law's help, manages to enter the laboratory and opens the gate to allow the G-5 Marines to get inside before the poison gas overtakes them. The Marines, who were about to give in to despair, are saved.
events.significance: Shows the beginning of cooperation between the Straw Hats and the G-5 Marines against Caesar.

events.title: All Groups Reunite Inside Laboratory
events.description: Zoro, Sanji, Brook, Kin'emon, and Brownbeard's group successfully enter through the cut gate, reuniting with Luffy's group and the G-5 Marines inside the laboratory, completing the escape from the poison gas.
events.significance: Brings all the scattered groups back together inside Caesar's laboratory, setting up the confrontation with Caesar.

events.title: Caesar Watches the Escape
events.description: From inside the laboratory, Caesar Clown watches the captives escape and wonders what they're planning. He comments that their corpses will be useful later, showing he's not concerned about the escape.
events.significance: Foreshadows the upcoming confrontation between the alliance and Caesar. Shows Caesar's overconfidence.

quotes.text: What are they doing? How desperate. Their corpses will be useful later.
quotes.speaker: Caesar Clown

quotes.text: While I freeloaded at Caesar's house, I swapped most of the seastone chains with normal ones.
quotes.speaker: Trafalgar Law

quotes.text: We have to live in order to protect our soldiers, bring Vergo to justice, and rescue the children.
quotes.speaker: Tashigi
quotes.context: Convincing Smoker to accept Law's deal

quotes.text: Can you cut iron? It's no problem.
quotes.speaker: Zoro and Kin'emon
quotes.context: Before cutting through the laboratory gate

themes.description: Law's elaborate plan to swap the seastone chains demonstrates the importance of thinking ahead and using deception to gain an advantage.
themes.symbolism: The fake chains represent Law's ability to manipulate situations to his advantage while appearing vulnerable.

themes.description: Both Law securing cooperation from Marines and the Kid Pirates alliance show how the New World requires pirates to work together despite traditional rivalries.
themes.symbolism: The coming together of enemies against greater threats represents the complex power dynamics of the New World.

themes.description: Zoro and Kin'emon's coordinated gate-cutting and the various groups helping each other escape showcase the power of cooperation.
themes.symbolism: The cutting of the gate represents breaking through barriers through collaboration.

characterSpotlights.development: Law demonstrates his cunning and long-term planning abilities, showing why he's a dangerous Supernova. His ability to think several steps ahead and manipulate situations is highlighted.
keyActions: Reveals he swapped seastone chains with fakes
Orchestrates the escape using Franky's smokescreen
Restores Smoker and Tashigi to their original bodies
quotes: While I freeloaded at Caesar's house, I swapped most of the seastone chains with normal ones.

characterSpotlights.development: Zoro works seamlessly with Kin'emon, showing his ability to coordinate with other swordsmen.
keyActions: Rides the dragon toward the laboratory
Coordinates with Kin'emon to cut the gate
Successfully cuts through the iron shutter

characterSpotlights.development: Tashigi shows her sense of duty and justice by convincing Smoker to accept Law's help to save their soldiers and the children.
keyActions: Prioritizes the safety of their soldiers
quotes: We have to live in order to protect our soldiers, bring Vergo to justice, and rescue the children.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime expanded on the underworld brokers' reactions to the captives, showing more of their surprised expressions.
The escape sequence with the poison gas chase was extended with more dramatic shots of the characters fleeing.

trivia.fact: This episode adapts nearly all of Chapter 677 (pages 2-19) in a single episode, which was relatively good pacing for the anime at this time.
The opening 'Hands Up!' by Kōta Shinzato was not initially available on Funimation's simulcast due to licensing issues, but was later restored.
Episode 603 aired during the period when One Piece had no ending themes (episodes 279-1070), using only opening themes.
Director Aya Komaki later became Series Director for One Piece episodes 892-961.
